text: How do we add a co-worker to this group?
Shoot me a DM with their email and I'll invite them
Or send them to <http://designers.HubSpot.com/slack>
<@U2Q5LPHGS> pinned a message to this channel.
anyone run into this before?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

not in that specific case there, or I can't get the orange bar back.

What I have found is font awesome 5 does whatever it is doing with SVGs so it is inserting them differently into the element, and you have to do some stuff to make it work
I'm just saying I don't care abotu it an inserting them into the LI element and styling it like that
<@U25PYL3Q8> Are you using the javascript?
the js+svg ya
hmm.
What version of IE were you having issue n?
looks based on the screenshot to be ie 11
cause the pseudos arent used anymore in fontawesome 5
unless you use the font
the js svg version is supposed to fallback when necessary, I’d guess it uses psuedos if certain feature tests fail (I don’t know for sure on that, just a guess)
yeah. That wouldbe my guess. BUT the svg is pretty cross platform.
I actually stopped using the js version and just started manually using the svgs.
yes, but IE has bugs with svg that they may have chosen to work around by just falling back to the old way. that’s my guess
surprisingly caniuse says the bugs still persist in Edge as well <https://caniuse.com/#search=svg>
ie11
Anyone had any success with request-based css modifications from HubDB ? (i.e. given a cell value ... perhaps a color code... set the color in the linked css file to the result)
I read that there was an issue not having display block on the after element
I have a css file getting linked that I want to use the current blog's slug as a key in a table to then return a few color values for that template
I guess I’m not entirely sure what you’re asking for. You can use values from a hubDB to set classes or set inline styles

If you’re wanting to generate a linked css file using hubDB I advise against it - all hubl inside of a css file is only executed on publish of the css file. therefore if the hubDB updates, the file does not
That's what I'm seeing happen - thanks for the help
Will have to either import instead of link or move to inline

your best bet will be to move inline I think.

importing has the same issue

Hey all, just a quick reminder that the Marketplace is now officially accepting module submissions from the general public! if you’d like to submit your own modules to the marketplace, take a look at the submission requirements here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/resources/what-are-the-module-requirements-for-the-marketplace> 

We’re planning on releasing the first round of modules in the next couple of weeks, so :rocket: submit away!

If you have any questions feel free to ping me :sprocket: or ask in <#C2YGWHDKQ|marketplace>

If you're on the fence about building (and then submitting) a module, I would highly recommend it. We're still very early in the game here, and it could be a great way to generate revenue for your agency -- or just efficiency with modules across various portals.
None of my Hack-y Modules meet those guidelines yet
lol happy to chat with you about them
This is my favorite response, and, same
Still in the early phase of attempting to use them <@U26B530N6> - I'll be sure to ping with specifics about the guidelines and application to the modules when they get a bit more refined
